relation: Great for these types of students
Regular patrols with call boxes everywhere and great lighting
Undecided students, returning adults, students trying to save money on school
You get a high level education for a fraction of the cost and almost every class will transfer for full credit to a larger institution.
There are plenty of clubs, intramural sports teams and organizations to get involved in while attending.
The food is good. There is not really a cafeteria, just a small dining area with a small variety.
The classes are just challenging as any other college and the workload is just as heavy.

Research you opportunities prior to choosing a major. You never know what scholarships, co ops or transfer agreements are available. Choose your major then your school. You will have an all around better experience.

Delaware County is a great school to begin your education if you want to pursue a bachelors degree. It is also a fantastic school to gain technical education and learn a trade. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the selection of majors is endless.
pageTitle: Delaware County Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {13459=no dorm, you have to commute.2345, 38581=Tips for all prospective students do not wait too long to schedule your classes. If your start date to schedule for summer is march 13th you need to be looking march 13th. Yes, it is true that you have until May to schedule your classes. But, the truth of the matter is that all the good classes, good as in times, get filled quickly. Try taking online courses, personally I love them they are extremely flexible and I tend to do better because it pushes me to work harder., 226974=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Dorm Life no dorms. Academic Rigor Imagine the things you don't know... that's what you'll learn. Tips for prospective students If you have any problems talk to your advisor, they are GODS! In three sentences Ratemyprofessor.com! Craigslist/FB search for books! Enjoy, seriously it goes by fast and then you're standing at graduation like.. how the hell?!
